# Driver's Licence Issued Outside Québec

As of December 15, 2025, new eligibility requirements for a Class 1 driver's licence will be in effect.

Exceptions will be made to allow anyone who began the process of obtaining a Class 1 licence before December 15, 2025 to continue following the steps required under the regulations in effect at that time, provided certain conditions are met. The SAAQ will contact all those covered by this measure between now and the end of the year.

To find out what is required in your particular situation, please fill out the form at the bottom of the page.

## Non-resident of Québec

If your principal residence is not in the province of Québec and you hold a valid driver's licence issued by another Canadian province or territory or another country, you can drive in Québec for six consecutive months. After that time, you must hold an international driving permit.

- If you are a temporary foreign worker, you are considered a **non-resident** if you are in one of the following situations:
- Your principal residence is not in Québec.
- You have the right to stay in Canada for six months or less.

## New resident in Québec

If your principal residence is in the province of Québec, you must obtain a Québec licence if you:

- have Canadian citizenship
- are a permanent resident
- have another type of immigration status

page_content:
If your principal residence is in the province of Québec, you must obtain a Québec licence if you:

- have Canadian citizenship
- are a permanent resident
- have another type of immigration status

You can apply for your licence as soon as you arrive.

If you are a temporary foreign worker, you are considered a **new resident** if you meet the following two criteria:

- Your principal residence is in Québec.
- You have the right to stay in Canada for longer than six months.

### Driving with a driver's licence issued outside Québec

As a new resident, you can drive the following vehicles for up to six consecutive months:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

However, your driver's licence issued outside Québec must be valid and authorize you to drive these categories of vehicles.

Even if your current licence authorizes you to, you may not drive:

- a truck or heavy vehicle combination
- an emergency vehicle
- a bus
- a minibus
- a taxi or a vehicle comparable to a taxi

To drive these vehicles, you must obtain a Québec licence of the appropriate class. Depending on the category of vehicle you wish to drive, you may have to take a training course and pass proficiency tests.

- ## 2 Student or trainee from elsewhere in Canada or another country

If you are a student or trainee from another Canadian province or territory or from abroad, you are allowed to drive for the duration of your studies or traineeship, provided:

- you have a valid driver's licence issued by another Canadian province or territory or a foreign country
- that licence authorizes you to drive the type of vehicle that you are using

You cannot obtain a Québec licence unless you decide to take up residence in Québec.

### Vehicles that you may drive

If your licence authorizes you to, you may drive:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

### What if your licence is written in a language other than French or English?

We recommend that you get an [international driver's permit](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/international-driving-permit) before coming to Québec.

- ## 3 Non-resident of Québec (visitor, tourist or other)

If you are travelling in Québec, you may drive for six consecutive months with your licence issued outside Québec, provided your licence:

- is valid
- authorizes you to drive the type of vehicle that you are using

### Vehicles that you may drive

You may drive any type of vehicle, as long as your licence issued outside Québec authorizes you to and you abide by its conditions.

### If you stay in Québec for longer than six months

You must hold a valid [international driving permit](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/international-driving-permit) to be allowed to continue to drive on Québec roads.

You must always drive with both licences - your driver's licence issued outside Québec and your international driving permit. You are allowed to drive in Québec for as long as both these licences are valid.

The international driving permit can only be issued in the country in which you obtained your driver's licence , and may be valid for one to three years. You must apply for your permit before coming to Québec.

### If your licence is written in a language other than French or English

We recommend that you get an [international driving permit](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/international-driving-permit) before coming to Québec, regardless of the length of your stay.

### If you take up residence in Québec

If your licence issued outside Québec authorizes you to, you may operate a passenger vehicle, motorcycle or moped or scooter during the first six months after setting in Québec.

page_content:
If your licence issued outside Québec authorizes you to, you may operate a passenger vehicle, motorcycle or moped or scooter during the first six months after setting in Québec.

After that time, you are required to hold a Québec licence. You may apply for a Québec licence as soon as you settle in the province. The process for obtaining such a licence varies depending on which jurisdiction issued your driver's licence.

- ## 4 Your driver's licence was issued elsewhere in Canada

- ### Documents to provide

**Documents required to check your eligibility**
- Your licence issued elsewhere in Canada
- Proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- Proof of residency in Québec
- Proof that you were a resident in the province or territory that issued your licence **if you obtained your licence within the previous three years**
- Your driving record (recommended)
- ### Costs

[Licence Fees for the Current Year](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees)

The [fees to renew, replace and exchange a driver's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the class(es) sought and the validity period of the licence.

## Vehicles that you may drive during the first six months

During the **first 6 months after settling in Québec,** you may drive:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

However, make sure that your driver's licence issued elsewhere in Canada:

However, make sure that your driver's licence issued elsewhere in Canada:

- is valid
- authorizes you to drive the type of road vehicle that you are using

### Vehicles that you may not drive with your licence issued elsewhere in Canada

Even if your current licence authorizes you to, you may not drive:

- a truck or heavy vehicle combination
- an emergency vehicle
- a bus
- a minibus
- a taxi or a vehicle comparable to a taxi

### Québec driver's licence required after the first six months

Here is the procedure to obtain a Québec licence, according to the road vehicle that you drive. You can begin the application process as soon as you settle in Québec.

#### For all road vehicles, except heavy vehicle combinations (Class 1)

You must exchange your licence issued in another Canadian jurisdiction for a Québec licence corresponding to the [equivalent class](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes).

#### If your licence is valid or expired less than three years ago

You do not have to pass any proficiency tests to obtain a driver's licence.

#### If your licence expired three or more years age

You must pass the proficiency tests to obtain a new licence of the desired class.

#### For a truck, emergency vehicle, bus or minibus

You must submit a medical examination report.

**For heavy vehicle combinations (Class 1)**

1. **If you have completed a** **recognized training course****AND**
- your driver's licence is valid or expired less than three years ago:
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You can exchange your driver's licence without having to pass the proficiency tests
- your driver's licence expired three or more years ago:
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests
2. If you **have not** completed a recognized training course

- You must undergo a medical examination
- You can exchange your driver's licence without having to pass the proficiency tests
- your driver's licence expired three or more years ago:
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests
- **If you have between 12 and 24 months of experience driving a** [**Class 1**](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/heavy-vehicle/drivers-licence-class-1) **(or equivalent) vehicle AND**
- your driver's licence is valid or expired less than three years ago:
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests

page_content:
### Procedure to exchange your licence

**Step 1**- Meet the following conditions:

- be aged 16 or older (or 14 for a Class 6D licence for a moped or scooter with an engine displacement of 50 cc or less)
- hold a driver's licence issued in another Canadian jurisdiction
- have your principal residence in Québec
- have Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada for more than six months

**Step 2 -** Request an appointment

Online

Request an [appointment to have your driving experience acquired outside Québec](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/make-appointment/exchange-drivers-licence) recognized by completing the form on our website.

If you need help completing the form, please call 1‐833‐762-1502.

We will contact you by phone or email within 20 business days after receiving your completed form.

**Step 3 -** Go to your service centre appointment with the following original documents:

- your driver's licence from another Canadian province or territory
- proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- proof of residency in Québec
- proof that you were a resident in the province or territory that issued your licence if you have held your licence for less than three years
- your driving record **(recommended)**

In certain situations, other documents may be required. When one of our representatives contacts you to schedule an appointment, be sure to ask which documents you must bring with you.

**Step 4**- Pass the proficiency tests, if required

page_content:
**Step 4**- Pass the proficiency tests, if required

### Knowledge test

Depending on your situation, you may be able to take the knowledge test at the service centre **on the same day** as your appointment, or you may have to make another appointment. The fees for the test are $13.50.

### Road tests

Once you pass the knowledge test, you may make an appointment for the road test or test (depending on the desired licence class).

#### Online

You can make an appointment via [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

#### By phone

If you wish to make an appointment for a knowledge or road test, but you do not have a Health Insurance Card because you have not been living in Québec for very long, call 1-800-361-7620, then press 2 and 2 again to speak to one of our representatives.

**Step 5 -** Pay the licence exchange fees

The [licence exchange fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the licence class, and are higher if you apply for an additional licence class.

#### Payment options

At our service outlets, we accept payment:

- in cash
- by debit card (not available at some service outlets)
- by one or more [pre-authorized debits](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/payment-pre-authorized-debits) (a cheque specimen must be provided)
- by cheque or money order

**Payment by credit card is not accepted**.

## Driving experience

If the SAAQ recognizes that you have less than 24 months of experience driving a passenger vehicle, you will obtain a probationary licence. You will hold this licence until 24 months of driving experience have been recognized. We determine your experience on the basis of your driver's licence and driving record.

- ## 5 Your driver's licence was issued in the United States

- ### Documents to provide

**Documents required to confirm your eligibility**
- Your American driver's licence
- Proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- Proof of residency in Québec
- Proof that you were a resident in the American state that issued your licence **if you obtained your licence within the last three years**
- Your driving record (recommended)
- ### Costs

[Licence Fees for the Current Year](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees)

The [fees to renew, replace and exchange a driver's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the class(es) sought and the validity period of the licence.

Exceptional measures have been put into place for individuals who, **prior to** **December 15, 2025,** **were declared eligible** to exchange their licence authorizing them to drive heavy vehicle combinations (Class 1).

- you must undergo a medical examination;
- you must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests.

### Vehicles that you may drive during the first six months

During the **first six months after settling in Québec** you may drive:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

However, make sure that your foreign licence:

- is valid
- authorizes you to drive the type of road vehicle that you are using

#### Québec driver's licence required after the first six months

Here is the procedure to obtain a Québec licence, according to the road vehicle that you drive. You can begin the application process as soon as you settle in Québec.

#### For a passenger vehicle, moped or scooter, or a farm tractor

You must exchange your American foreign licence for a Québec licence corresponding to the equivalent class.

#### If your licence is valid or expired less than three years ago

You do not have to pass a proficiency tests to obtain a passenger vehicle, farm tractor, moped or scooter licence.

#### If your licence expired three or more years ago

You must pass proficiency tests before exchanging your American licence for a Québec passenger vehicle, farm tractor, moped or scooter licence.

page_content:
You must pass proficiency tests before exchanging your American licence for a Québec passenger vehicle, farm tractor, moped or scooter licence.

#### For a motorcycle

You must exchange your American licence to operate a motorcycle for a Québec licence after first passing the [motorcycle (Classes 6A, 6B and 6C)](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/motorcycle-6a-6b-6c-6e/motorcycle-classes-6a-6b-6c) proficiency tests.

#### For a truck, emergency vehicle, bus or minibus

You must exchange your American licence for a Québec licence corresponding to the equivalent class. To do so, you must:

- undergo a medical examination
- pass the proficiency tests (knowledge test and road tests) to obtain the desired [licence class](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes)

**For heavy vehicle combinations (Class 1)**

page_content:
**For heavy vehicle combinations (Class 1)**

1. **If you have 24 or more months of experience driving a** **Class 1****(or equivalent) vehicle:**
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests
2. **If you have between 12 and 24 months of experience driving a** **Class 1****(or equivalent) vehicle AND**
- your driver's licence is valid or expired less than three years ago:
- You must undergo a medical examination
- You must pass the Class 1 knowledge and road tests
- If you fail the Class 1 tests twice, you will be required to complete mandatory training
- your driver's licence expired three or more years ago:
- You must complete [mandatory training](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/heavy-vehicle/drivers-licence-class-1)
3. **If you have less than 12 months of experience driving a** **Class 1** **(or equivalent) vehicle:**
- You must complete [mandatory training](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/heavy-vehicle/drivers-licence-class-1)

## Procedure to exchange your licence

**Step 1**- Meet the following conditions:

- be aged 16 or older (or 14 for a Class 6D licence for a moped or scooter with an engine displacement of 50 cc or less)
- hold an American licence
- have your principal residence in Québec
- have Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada for more than six months

**Step 2** - Request an appointment

Online

page_content:
**Step 2** - Request an appointment

Online

Request an [appointment to have your driving experience acquired outside Québec](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/make-appointment/exchange-drivers-licence) recognized by completing the form.

If you need help completing the form, please call 1 833 762-1502.

We will contact you by phone or email within 20 business days after receiving your completed form.

**Step 3** - Go to your service centre where you have your appointment with the following original documents:

- your American driver's licence
- proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- proof of residency in Québec
- proof that you resided in the American jurisdiction that issued your licence **if you** **have held your licence for less than three years**
- your driving record (recommended)

In certain situations, other documents may be required. When one of our representatives contacts you to schedule an appointment, be sure to ask which documents you must bring with you.

**Step 4**(optional) - Pass the motorcycle proficiency tests (Classes 6A, 6B and 6C)

To help you prepare for the tests, we recommend you study the following publications, as applicable:

**Step 4**(optional) - Pass the motorcycle proficiency tests (Classes 6A, 6B and 6C)

To help you prepare for the tests, we recommend you study the following publications, as applicable:

- [Driver's Handbook (PDF, 22.9 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/drivers-handbook.pdf) (electronic version available free of charge)
- [Driving a Passenger Vehicle (PDF, 19.0 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/driving-passenger-vehicle.pdf) (electronic version available free of charge)
- [Operating a Motorcycle (PDF, 7.3 MB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/operating-motorcycle.pdf) (electronic version available free of charge)

Paper versions can also be purchased at bookstores in Québec.

You can also read:

- the **Road Access Binder**, available in both French and English at driving schools recognized by the SAAQ

### Knowledge test

Depending on your situation, you may be able to take the knowledge test at the service centre **on the same day** as your appointment, or you may have to make another appointment. The fees for the test are $13.50.

### Road tests

Once you pass the knowledge test, you may make an appointment for the road tests:

**Online**

You can make an appointment via [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

**By phone**

**Online**

You can make an appointment via [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

**By phone**

If you wish to make an appointment for a knowledge or road test, but you do not have a Health Insurance Card because you have not been living in Québec for very long, call 1-800-361-7620, then press 2 and 2 again to speak to one of our representatives.

On the day of your road test(s), you must pay the [applicable fees⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange ""). Once you pass the applicable road test(s), you will be allowed to exchange your licence.

On the day of the road test, you must pay the [applicable fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange). If you pass the test, you will be allowed to exchange your licence.

**Step 5** - Pay the licence exchange fees

The [licence exchange fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the licence class, and are higher if you apply for an additional licence class.

#### Payment options

At our service outlets, we accept payment:

- in cash
- by debit card (not available at some service outlets)
- by one or more [pre-authorized debits](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/payment-pre-authorized-debits) (a cheque specimen must be provided)
- by cheque or money order

**Payment by credit card is not accepted**.

**Payment by credit card is not accepted**.

##### Driving experience

If the SAAQ considers that you have less than 24 months of experience driving a passenger vehicle, you will obtain a probationary licence. You will hold this licence until 24 months of driving experience have been recognized. We base ourselves on your American driver's licence and driving record when recognizing your months of driving experience.

- ## 6 Your licence was issued in a jurisdiction with an agreement

- ### Costs

Motorcycle (Classes 6A, 6B and 6C)

- Knowledge test: $13.50
- Closed track road test: $33.75
- Road test: $119.00

[Licence Fees for the Current Year](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees)

The [fees to renew, replace and exchange a driver's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the class(es) sought and the licence validity period.

Note that if you previously held a Québec driver's licence that was cancelled or expired three or more years ago, you will not have to take the knowledge or road tests for a class covered by that licence if you meet the following two conditions:
- Your foreign driver's licence bears the equivalent class
- Your foreign driver's licence is valid or expired less than three years ago
- ### Documents to provide

page_content:
**Documents required to confirm your eligibility**
- Your foreign driver's licence
- Proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- Proof of residency in Québec
- Proof that you were a resident in the country that issued your licence **if you** **have held your licence for less than three years**
- An official or certified translation of any required documents written in a language other than French or English

### Vehicles that you may drive during the first six months

During the **first six months after settling in Québec** you may drive:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

However, make sure that your foreign licence:

- is valid
- authorizes you to drive the type of road vehicle that you are using

#### Québec driver's licence required after the first six months

Here is the procedure to obtain a Québec licence, according to the road vehicle that you drive. You can begin the application process as soon as you settle in Québec.

#### For a passenger vehicle or moped or scooter

You must exchange your foreign licence for a Québec licence.

#### For a motorcycle

You must exchange your foreign licence to operate a motorcycle for a Québec licence after first passing the [motorcycle(Classes 6A, 6B and 6C)](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/motorcycle-6a-6b-6c-6e/motorcycle-classes-6a-6b-6c) proficiency tests. You may begin the application process as soon as you arrive in Québec.

page_content:
#### If your licence has expired

In most cases, you must pass the applicable proficiency tests to obtain a passenger vehicle or moped or scooter licence.

### Vehicles that you may not drive with a foreign licence

Even if your foreign licence authorizes you to, you may not drive:

- a truck or heavy vehicle combination
- an emergency vehicle
- a bus
- a minibus
- a taxi or a vehicle comparable to a taxi

#### Procedure to be authorized to drive these vehicles (Class 1, 2, 3, 4A and 4B vehicles)

You must first [obtain a Québec Classe 5 licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence). After that, you will be able to apply for any other [licence class](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes) you wish to obtain by meeting the requirements specific to that licence class and following the graduated licensing process.

### Procedure to exchange your licence

**Step 1** - Meet the following conditions:

- be aged 16 or older (or 14 for a Class 6D licence for a moped or scooter with an engine displacement of 50 cc or less)
- have a foreign driver's licence authorizing you to drive a passenger vehicle or operate a motorcycle or moped or scooter
- have your principal residence in Québec
- have Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada for more than six months

**Step 2** - Request an appointment

**Online**

If you need help completing the form, please call 1 833 762-1502.

We will contact you by phone or email within 20 business days after receiving your completed form.

**Step 3**- Go to your service centre appointment with the following original documents:

- your foreign driver's licence
- proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- proof of residency in Québec
- proof that you were a resident of the country that issued your driver's licence was licence **if you have held your licence for less than three years**
- your driving record (recommended)
- An official or certified translation of any required documents written in a language other than French or English (the international driver's permit is not considered an official translation of your driver's licence)

In certain situations, other documents may be required. When one of our representatives contacts you to schedule an appointment, be sure to ask which documents you must bring with you.

## Translation of documents written in a language other than French or English

You must have them translated by a translator who is a member of one of the following:

## Translation of documents written in a language other than French or English

You must have them translated by a translator who is a member of one of the following:

- the [Ordre des traducteurs, terminologues et interprètes agréés du Québec⁠ ⁠](http://ottiaq.org/en/) (OTTIAQ)
- the [Association of Legal Court Interpreters and Translators⁠ ⁠](http://www.atij.ca/) (ALCIT)
- an association that is a member of the [Canadian Translators, Terminologists and Interpreters Council⁠ ⁠](http://www.cttic.org/mission.asp?lang=E) (CTTIC)

If you hold a driver's licence from Japan:

- If your licence is **expired**, you must have it translated as indicated above.
- If your licence is **valid**, a translation is not required. However, you must obtain a certificate from the Consulate of Japan.

**Step 4** - Pass the applicable proficiency tests

To help you prepare for the tests, we recommend you study the following publications, as applicable:

- [Driver's Handbook (PDF, 22.9 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/drivers-handbook.pdf) (electronic version available free of charge)

page_content:
#### Payment options

At our service outlets, we accept payment:

- in cash
- by debit card (not available at some service outlets)
- by one or more [pre-authorized debits](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/payment-pre-authorized-debits) (a cheque specimen must be provided)
- by cheque or money order

**Payment by credit card is not accepted**.

##### Driving experience

If the SAAQ considers that you have less than 24 months of experience driving a passenger vehicle, you will obtain a probationary licence. You will hold this licence until 24 months of driving experience have been recognized. We base ourselves on your American driver's licence and driving record when recognizing your months of driving experience.

- ## 7 Your driver's licence was issued in a jurisdiction that is not covered by an agreement

- ### Costs

**Knowledge test**

$13.50

**Road test**

Class 5 (passenger vehicle): $33.75

[Licence Fees for the Current Year](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees)

The [fees to renew, replace and exchange a driver's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the class(es) sought and the licence validity period.

page_content:
Note that if you previously held a Québec driver's licence that was cancelled or expired three or more years ago, you will not have to take the knowledge or road tests for a class covered by that licence if you meet the following two conditions:
- Your foreign driver's licence bears the equivalent class
- Your foreign driver's licence is valid or expired less than three years ago
- ### Documents to provide

**Documents required to confirm your eligibility**
- Your foreign driver's licence
- Proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- Proof of residence in Québec
- Proof of that you were a resident in the country or jurisdiction that issued your licence **if you** **have held your licence for less than three years**
- An official or certified translation of any required documents written in a language other than French or English

### Vehicles that you may drive during the first six months

During the **first six months after settling in Québec** you may drive:

- a passenger vehicle
- a motorcycle
- a moped or scooter

However, make sure that your foreign licence:

- is valid
- authorizes you to drive the type of road vehicle that you are using

#### Québec driver's licence required after the first six months

Here is the procedure to obtain a Québec licence, according to the road vehicle that you drive. You can begin the application process as soon as you settle in Québec.

### Important!

page_content:
Here is the procedure to obtain a Québec licence, according to the road vehicle that you drive. You can begin the application process as soon as you settle in Québec.

### Important!

Should you fail the road test, you will no longer be authorized to drive with your foreign driver's licence. Instead, you will be issued a learner's licence, which comes with the following conditions:

- You must be accompanied while driving by someone who holds a valid Québec Class 5 driver's licence and has at least two years of driving experience.
- You must not drive between midnight and 5 a.m.
- You must abide by the zero-alcohol rule
- You must have less than [four demerit points](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/demerit-points) entered on your driving record

It is therefore important that someone with a valid driver's licence accompany you to your road test, as that person will be able to drive you home if need be.

If you fail the road test, you will have to [pay for a learner's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees).

Please note that you must wait at least 28 days before you can retake the road test. [You will have to make a new appointment⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/tourists-newcomers/preparing-tests "").

Once you pass the road test, you will be issued either a probationary licence or a regular driver's licence, depending on your the years of driving experience recognized by the SAAQ.

### For a passenger vehicle

page_content:
### For a passenger vehicle

To be eligible to obtain a Class 5 Québec passenger vehicle licence by passing the required proficiency tests, you must have held a passenger vehicle driver's licence for **at least one year** before settling in Québec.

##### If you had less than one year of driving experience upon arrival in Québec

You must take a driving course and follow the [graduated licensing process](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/passenger-vehicle-class-5) to obtain a learner's licence.

#### For a motorcycle

You must take a driving course and follow the [graduated licensing process](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/motorcycle-6a-6b-6c-6e/motorcycle-classes-6a-6b-6c).

### Vehicles that you may not drive with a foreign licence

Even if your foreign licence authorizes you to do so, you may not drive:

- a truck or heavy vehicle combination
- an emergency vehicle
- a bus
- a minibus
- a taxi or a vehicle comparable to a taxi

#### Procedure to be authorized to drive these vehicles (Class 1, 2, 3, 4A and 4B vehicles)

You must obtain a Québec driver's licence corresponding to the [appropriate class](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes). To do so, you must first:

You must obtain a Québec driver's licence corresponding to the [appropriate class](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes). To do so, you must first:

- obtain a Class 5 Québec driver's licence
- follow [the graduated licensing process](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/obtaining-licence/passenger-vehicle-class-5) for any other type of vehicle you wish to drive

## Procedure to obtain a licence

**Step 1**- Meet the following conditions:

- be aged 16 or older
- hold a foreign licence authorizing you to drive a passenger vehicle
- have your principal residence in Québec
- have Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada for more than six months

**Step 2** - Request an appointment

**Online**

Request an [appointment to have your driving experience acquired outside Québec recognized](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/make-appointment/exchange-drivers-licence) by completing the form on our website.

If you need help completing the form, please call 1-833-306-3041.

We will contact you by phone or email within 20 business days after receiving your completed form.

**Step 3** - Go to your service centre appointment with the following original documents:

**Step 3** - Go to your service centre appointment with the following original documents:

- your foreign driver's licence
- proof of Canadian citizenship or the right to stay in Canada
- proof of residence in Québec
- proof that you were a resident of the country that issued your driver's licence **if you obtained your** **have held your licence for less than three years**
- an official or certified translation of any documents written in a language other than French or English (the international driver's permit is not considered an official translation of your driver's licence)

In certain situations, other documents may be required. When one of our representatives contacts you to schedule an appointment, be sure to ask which documents you must bring with you.

#### Translation of documents written in a language other than French or English

You must have them translated by a translator who is a member of one of the following:

- the [Ordre des traducteurs, terminologues et interprètes agréés du Québec⁠ ⁠](http://ottiaq.org/en/) (OTTIAQ)
- the [Association of Legal Court Interpreters and Translators⁠ ⁠](http://www.atij.ca/) (ALCIT)
- an association that is a member of the [Canadian Translators, Terminologists and Interpreters Council⁠ ⁠](http://www.cttic.org/mission.asp?lang=E) (CTTIC)

**Step 4** - Pass the proficiency tests

page_content:
**Step 4** - Pass the proficiency tests

To help you [prepare for the tests⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/tourists-newcomers/preparing-tests ""), we recommend you study the following publications, which are available in Québec bookstores but can also be downloaded free of charge here:

- [Driver's Handbook (PDF, 22.9 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/drivers-handbook.pdf)
- [Driving a Passenger Vehicle (PDF, 19.0 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/driving-passenger-vehicle.pdf) (electronic version available free of charge)

Paper versions can also be purchased at bookstores in Québec.

You can also read:

- the **Road Access Binder**, available in both French and English from driving schools recognized by the SAAQ

##### Knowledge test

Depending on your situation, you may be able to take the knowledge test at the service centre **on the same day** as your appointment, or you may have to make another appointment. The test fee is $13.50.

##### Road test

Once you pass the knowledge test, you can schedule an appointment for the road test:

**Online**

You can make an appointment through [SAAQclic.⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login)

**By phone**

**Online**

You can make an appointment through [SAAQclic.⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login)

**By phone**

If you wish to make an appointment for a knowledge or road test, but you do not have a Health Insurance Card because you have not been living in Québec for very long, call 1-800-361-7620, then press 2 and 2 again to speak to one of our representatives.

On the day of your road test, you must pay the [applicable fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-knowledge-road-tests). Once you pass the road test, you can obtain a licence.

**Step 5** - Pay the applicable fees to obtain your licence

The [licence fees](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/drivers-licence/fees-renew-replace-exchange) vary depending on the licence class.

#### Payment options

At our service outlets, we accept payment:

- in cash
- by debit card (not available at some service outlets)
- by one or more [pre-authorized debits](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/payment-pre-authorized-debits) (a cheque specimen must be provided)
- by cheque or money order

**Payment by credit card is not accepted**.

That's why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
